sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: What is the area of a sector of a circle with a radius of 7 cm and a central angle of 45 degrees?
message_2:
To find the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle in degrees / 360) × π × radius²

In this case, the radius is 7 cm and the central angle is 45 degrees. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (45 / 360) × π × 7²

Area of sector = (1/8) × π × 49

Area of sector = 49π/8

The area of the sector is (49π/8) square centimeters.
